snippet: Ten men were charged with murdering a Muslim man over rumors that a cow had been killed, raising questions about a group allied with Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party.
abstract: Hindu members of Save the Cow express little regret for killing Mohammed Ikhlaq and putting his son in critical condition in village of Bisada, India following unfounded allegations that Ikhlaq had slaughtered cow; organization is led by many who are also prominent within local branches of Prime Min Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party, and while party leaders deplore mob violence, they also question decision by police to bring murder charges against perpetrators.

byline.original: By DAVID BARSTOW and SUHASINI RAJ

lead_paragraph: Ten men were charged with murdering a Muslim man over rumors that a cow had been killed, raising questions about a group allied with Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s party.

headline.main: Mob Attack, Fueled by Rumors of Cow Slaughter, Has Political Overtones in India
headline.print_headline: Indian Politics Are Backdrop in Mob Attack
